Sentencas: In the present study, a combined heat and power system with a prime-mover of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) was modeled and validated against experimental data available in the literature.
Titulo: Multi-objective optimization of a power generation system based SOFC using Taguchi/AHP/TOPSIS triple method

Sentencas: Different response variables were considered and the optimum conditions were recognized using the signal to noise ratio analysis of the Taguchi approach to individually maximize/minimize the response variables.
Titulo: Multi-objective optimization of a power generation system based SOFC using Taguchi/AHP/TOPSIS triple method

Sentencas: These optimum conditions were selected as different alternatives and the response variables were considered as the criteria for multi-criteria decision making problem.
Titulo: Multi-objective optimization of a power generation system based SOFC using Taguchi/AHP/TOPSIS triple method

Sentencas: The multi-objective optimization problem was solved using a couple of methods of analytical hierarchy process/technique for order preferences by similarity to ideal solution.
Titulo: Multi-objective optimization of a power generation system based SOFC using Taguchi/AHP/TOPSIS triple method

Sentencas: The contributions of each parameter on the response variables were calculated using analysis of variance tool of Taguchi approach.
Titulo: Multi-objective optimization of a power generation system based SOFC using Taguchi/AHP/TOPSIS triple method

Sentencas: The current density is the most effective parameter on the electrical power with the contribution of 71.5%.
Titulo: Multi-objective optimization of a power generation system based SOFC using Taguchi/AHP/TOPSIS triple method

Sentencas: Power was significantly increased by the current density.
Titulo: Multi-objective optimization of a power generation system based SOFC using Taguchi/AHP/TOPSIS triple method

Sentencas: The current density of 5500 A/m(2), the SOFC outlet temperature of 950 degrees C, and the fuel utilization factor of 0.8 were selected as the multi-objective optimum condition.
Titulo: Multi-objective optimization of a power generation system based SOFC using Taguchi/AHP/TOPSIS triple method

Sentencas: In this condition, the electrical energy efficiency is maximum (48.03%), the CO2 emission is minimum (281.4 kg/MW.h), and the electrical exergy efficiency is maximum (46.33%).
Titulo: Multi-objective optimization of a power generation system based SOFC using Taguchi/AHP/TOPSIS triple method
